questions.text: A 24-year-old woman with no prior refractive error undergoes LASIK surgery. Her identical twin, who underwent phakic intraocular lens implantation instead, has identical axial length and lens characteristics. Scenario A: LASIK was performed reducing the anterior corneal curvature. Scenario B: A high refractive index phakic IOL was implanted anterior to the natural lens. Which of the following correctly compares the optical outcomes between Scenario A and Scenario B?

options.label: A
options.text: Myopic shift occurs in Scenario A; emmetropia maintained in Scenario B

options.label: B
options.text: Hyperopic shift occurs in Scenario A; increased effective lens power in Scenario B

options.label: C
options.text: No change in total refractive power in either scenario

options.label: D
options.text: Scenario A increases anterior chamber depth; Scenario B reduces axial length

questions.correct_answer: B. Hyperopic shift occurs in Scenario A; increased effective lens power in Scenario B
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Hyperopic shift occurs in Scenario A; increased effective lens power in Scenario B

questions.text: A 58-year-old diabetic woman complains of mild blurring of central vision. OCT confirms macular edema. Fundoscopy reveals hard exudates in a circinate pattern around the fovea. Which finding supports the diagnosis of clinically significant macular edema (CSME) by Modified Airlie House Criteria?

options.label: A
options.text: Microaneurysms within 500 microns of the fovea

options.label: B
options.text: Any exudates in the macular area

options.label: C
options.text: Retinal thickening within 500 microns of the fovea

options.label: D
options.text: Cotton wool spot within 1 disc diameter of the fovea

questions.correct_answer: C. Retinal thickening within 500 microns of the fovea
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Retinal thickening within 500 microns of the fovea

questions.text: A 3-year-old girl has upward deviation of the right eye noted for 2 months. Cover test confirms right hypertropia. Forced duction test is positive. MRI is normal. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A 60-year-old male presents with decreased vision due to bullous keratopathy following cataract surgery. Which corneal transplant technique is most appropriate to restore vision with minimal surgical trauma

options.label: C
options.text: DSAEK – Descemet’s stripping automated endothelial keratoplasty

questions.correct_answer: C. DSAEK – Descemet’s stripping automated endothelial keratoplasty
questions.explanation: Ans. C)  DSAEK – Descemet’s stripping automated endothelial keratoplasty

questions.text: A researcher is studying the role of magnocellular vs parvocellular pathways in visual processing. Which of the following correctly differentiates their functional roles and anatomical inputs in the lateral geniculate body (LGB)?

options.label: A
options.text: Magnocellular layers (3,4,5) – High acuity & color vision; Ipsilateral input

options.label: B
options.text: Parvocellular layers (1,2) – Movement detection; Contralateral input

options.label: C
options.text: Parvocellular layers (3,4,5,6) – Color and fine details; Ipsilateral & contralateral input

options.label: D
options.text: Magnocellular layers (1,2) – Motion detection; Layers 1,4,6 receive contralateral input

questions.correct_answer: D. Magnocellular layers (1,2) – Motion detection; Layers 1,4,6 receive contralateral input
questions.explanation: Ans. D)  Magnocellular layers (1,2) – Motion detection; Layers 1,4,6 receive contralateral input

questions.text: What is the spherical equivalent of the following prescription: -2.00 sphere with -1.00 cylinder at 180°?

A 60-year-old man presents with bilateral small, irregular pupils that do not constrict to light but constrict on accommodation. Neurological examination shows ataxia, and serology is positive for Treponema pallidum. Which of the following best explains the pupil abnormality?

options.label: C
options.text: Damage to the pretectal area of the midbrain

questions.correct_answer: C. Damage to the pretectal area of the midbrain
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Damage to the pretectal area of the midbrain

questions.text: A 58-year-old woman presents with horizontal diplopia and blurry vision. Examination reveals that during rightward gaze, her left eye fails to adduct, while the right eye abducts with nystagmus. Convergence is preserved. MRI shows demyelinating lesions. Which of the following differentiates this condition from a 3rd nerve palsy?

options.label: D
options.text: Impaired elevation and depression in adduction

questions.correct_answer: B. Nystagmus in the abducting eye
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Nystagmus in the abducting eye

questions.text: A 29-year-old woman with a stable refractive error of -7.00D seeks LASIK. Her slit-lamp exam is normal. Her medical history includes systemic lupus erythematosus, currently managed with hydroxychloroquine. Her corneal thickness is 520 microns. Which of the following is the strongest contraindication to LASIK in this patient?

A 4-year-old boy is scheduled for cataract extraction after being diagnosed with a congenital cataract in his left eye. The ophthalmologist decides against performing intracapsular cataract extraction (ICCE) and instead plans for an extracapsular procedure. Which of the following anatomical features most strongly supports this decision?

options.label: A
options.text: Zonular fibers are underdeveloped in children

options.label: B
options.text: Cortical fibers are less organized in early life

options.label: C
options.text: The posterior lens capsule is thin and fragile

options.label: D
options.text: Weigert’s ligament is stronger in childhood

questions.correct_answer: D. Weigert’s ligament is stronger in childhood
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Weigert’s ligament is stronger in childhood

questions.text: A 65-year-old patient presents with a gradual decrease in visual acuity and is diagnosed with nuclear sclerosis. The lens appears yellow and hardened. Which of the following correctly describes the composition and metabolic characteristics of the lens contributing to its function and aging?

options.label: A
options.text: The lens contains 90% protein and is metabolically aerobic

options.label: B
options.text: The lens contains 66% water and depends primarily on the Kreb cycle

options.label: C
options.text: The lens is made of 66% water, 33% protein, and relies mainly on anaerobic metabolism

options.label: D
options.text: The lens uses aqueous-derived glucose in the TCA cycle as its primary energy source

questions.correct_answer: C. The lens is made of 66% water, 33% protein, and relies mainly on anaerobic metabolism
questions.explanation: Ans. C) The lens is made of 66% water, 33% protein, and relies mainly on anaerobic metabolism

questions.text: A 70-year-old female presents 6 months after uncomplicated cataract surgery with gradual visual decline. Slit-lamp exam reveals shiny, proliferative clusters behind the IOL. What is the most likely cause of her symptoms?

A 29-year-old woman is incidentally found to have bilateral reddish-brown streaks radiating from the optic disc during a routine eye exam. She is asymptomatic. Fundus fluorescein angiography shows window defects corresponding to Bruch’s membrane breaks. Which of the following systemic diseases is most likely associated?

A 58-year-old woman with a history of LASIK for high myopia 10 years ago now presents for cataract surgery. Her corneal curvature on keratometry is 38 D, and axial length is 26 mm. The surgeon mentions that standard SRK formula may not be reliable in her case. Which formula would be most appropriate for calculating her IOL power?
During a strabismus work-up, a 6-year-old is found to have left hypertropia. On Bielschowsky head tilt test, the hypertropia worsens on left tilt. Which muscle is most likely paretic?

A 70-year-old emmetropic man undergoes successful cataract extraction with Extended Depth of Focus (EDOF) intraocular lens (IOL) implantation. At his 1-month follow-up, he reports excellent distance and intermediate vision but complains of persistent difficulty in reading fine print. He is disappointed as he expected complete freedom from glasses. His slit-lamp exam is unremarkable, and visual acuity is 6/6 uncorrected for distance. Which of the following best explains the reason for his residual near vision difficulty?

options.label: B
options.text: EDOF lenses fail to correct astigmatism

questions.correct_answer: A. Accommodative amplitude is not restored
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Accommodative amplitude is not restored

questions.text: A 58-year-old man undergoes a routine eye exam. Fundoscopy reveals a cup-to-disc ratio (CDR) of 0.65 in the right eye and 0.35 in the left eye. He has no visual complaints but reports that his father went blind from glaucoma. IOP is 18 mmHg in both eyes. Which of the following is the most likely next step in evaluation?

options.label: A
options.text: No further testing is needed due to normal IOP

options.label: B
options.text: Perform visual field testing and optic nerve imaging

questions.correct_answer: B. Perform visual field testing and optic nerve imaging
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Perform visual field testing and optic nerve imaging

questions.text: A 7-year-old girl complains of diplopia and is found to have limitation of abduction in the right eye. On forced duction test, passive movement is restricted. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 2-month-old with suspected congenital glaucoma is being evaluated under anesthesia. Which of the following tonometers is most appropriate for IOP measurement in this setting?

Assertion (A): Orbital decompression is considered in thyroid eye disease for cases with proptosis. Reason (R): Orbital decompression immediately improves the angle of strabismus and resolves all diplopia.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation for A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation for A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true, but R is false

options.label: D
options.text: A is false, but R is true

questions.correct_answer: C. A is true, but R is false
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A is true, but R is false

questions.text: A 65-year-old man complains of gradual loss of central vision in both eyes. Fundoscopy reveals soft confluent drusens and areas of retinal pigment epithelium (RPE) atrophy. OCT shows RPE thinning without fluid. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

A 40-year-old man develops anisocoria that is more evident in dim light. The affected eye shows ptosis, miosis, and anhidrosis. What additional feature can help differentiate congenital Horner’s syndrome from acquired forms?
questions.correct_answer: B. Ipsilateral heterochromia of the iris
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Ipsilateral heterochromia of the iris.

questions.text: A 60-year-old immunocompromised man presents with eye pain and vesicular skin lesions over the right forehead and nose. Slit-lamp shows pseudodendritic ulcers without terminal bulbs. Which of the following confirms a higher risk of corneal involvement?

options.label: B
options.text: Positive corneal staining with Rose Bengal

questions.text: Which of the following statements about the spread of retinoblastoma is incorrect?

options.label: A
options.text: It commonly spreads via direct invasion into the choroid and optic nerve

options.label: B
options.text: CSF spread is the most common route of dissemination

options.label: C
options.text: Subarachnoid spread via the optic nerve sheath can lead to brain metastases

questions.correct_answer: B. CSF spread is the most common route of dissemination
questions.explanation: Ans. B) CSF spread is the most common route of dissemination

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman presents with recurrent episodes of eye pain and foreign body sensation upon awakening. Slit-lamp examination reveals map-like epithelial changes. Her family history is positive for similar complaints. What is the most likely type and layer of corneal dystrophy involved in this patient?
questions.correct_answer: C. Cogan’s microcystic dystrophy – Epithelial layer
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Cogan’s microcystic dystrophy – Epithelial layer

questions.text: Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding the optical correction of myopia?

options.label: A
options.text: A +1D lens reduces image size by 2%

options.label: B
options.text: Myopic correction uses convex lenses to focus light anterior to the retina

options.label: C
options.text: -1D lenses cause minification of the retinal image

options.label: D
options.text: High myopia is best corrected with magnifying devices

questions.correct_answer: C. -1D lenses cause minification of the retinal image
questions.explanation: Ans. C) -1D lenses cause minification of the retinal image

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding keratoconus are correct? Corneal collagen cross-linking is the only treatment that halts disease progression. Fleischer’s ring is due to calcium deposition in Descemet’s membrane. Munson's sign appears in early-stage keratoconus. Vogt’s striae disappear on applying pressure to the globe.

A clinician observes flame-shaped haemorrhages in a hypertensive patient during fundus examination. These haemorrhages are localized to the superficial nerve fiber layer. Which of the following best explains the anatomical basis for this pattern?

options.label: A
options.text: Horizontal orientation of Müller cells in the macula

options.label: B
options.text: Oblique axonal arrangement in Henle's layer

options.label: C
options.text: Superficial radial course of retinal arterioles and venules

options.label: D
options.text: High vascular density of the choroidal layer beneath the retina

questions.correct_answer: C. Superficial radial course of retinal arterioles and venules
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Superficial radial course of retinal arterioles and venules

questions.text: Which of the following statements about chlamydial conjunctivitis are true? It spreads via direct contact or fomites and is bilateral. Trachoma can lead to symblepharon, trichiasis, and entropion as sequelae. Herbert’s follicles are seen on the bulbar conjunctiva. The SAFE strategy is the recommended public health intervention.

A patient presents with metamorphopsia. OCT shows loss of foveal contour and neurosensory detachment. Fundus fluorescein angiography shows a "smoke-stack" leak pattern. Which test would best help differentiate this from early Retinitis Pigmentosa?

A patient suffers blunt trauma to the orbit and develops sudden loss of vision. On examination, there is no retinal damage. MRI shows damage to the segment of the optic nerve most vulnerable to trauma. Based on anatomical location, which part is most likely involved?

A patient with a right temporal lobe infarct presents with a specific visual field defect. Another patient with a right parietal lobe lesion shows a different defect. Which of the following pairs of defects is correctly matched with their respective lesions?

options.label: A
options.text: Right temporal lobe → Left superior quadrantanopia; Right parietal lobe → Left inferior quadrantanopia

options.label: B
options.text: Right temporal lobe → Right inferior quadrantanopia; Right parietal lobe → Right superior quadrantanopia

options.label: C
options.text: Right temporal lobe → Bitemporal hemianopia; Right parietal lobe → Central scotoma

options.label: D
options.text: Right temporal lobe → Left homonymous hemianopia; Right parietal lobe → Right superior quadrantanopia

questions.correct_answer: A. Right temporal lobe → Left superior quadrantanopia; Right parietal lobe → Left inferior quadrantanopia
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Right temporal lobe → Left superior quadrantanopia; Right parietal lobe → Left inferior quadrantanopia

questions.text: Which of the following statements about hypermetropia are true? It is associated with a shorter-than-normal eyeball. Convex lenses are used to correct hypermetropia. In manifest hypermetropia, vision is unaffected even without accommodation. Acute angle-closure glaucoma is more common in hypermetropes. Retinal changes such as "silk shot" retina may be seen.

A 50-year-old man with a known frontal lobe tumor presents with visual loss in the right eye and papilledema in the left eye. Examination reveals optic atrophy on the right and disc swelling on the left. Which of the following mechanisms best explains this presentation?

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral papilledema due to global ICP elevation

options.label: B
options.text: Compression of right optic nerve and raised ICP affecting contralateral eye

options.label: C
options.text: Pseudopapilledema due to optic disc drusen

options.label: D
options.text: Bilateral ischemic optic neuropathy due to systemic hypotension

questions.correct_answer: B. Compression of right optic nerve and raised ICP affecting contralateral eye
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Compression of right optic nerve and raised ICP affecting contralateral eye

questions.text: A 36-year-old patient presents with sudden onset of severe eye pain, nausea, and colored halos around lights. Slit-lamp reveals a mid-dilated non-reactive pupil and shallow anterior chamber. What finding would help you differentiate acute angle-closure glaucoma from anterior uveitis?

A 32-year-old female experiences worsening visual loss upon entering a hot tub. She had a previous episode of painful right eye vision loss 6 months ago. Which of the following clinical signs or phenomena best supports the underlying demyelinating nature of her optic neuritis?

A 28-year-old woman presents with progressive blurring of vision and difficulty reading in bright light. Examination shows a regular, dilated right pupil with sluggish light response but preserved accommodation. Deep tendon reflexes are decreased. Which of the following differentiates her condition from Argyll Robertson pupil?

A 70-year-old woman develops sudden visual blurring and mild eye pain three days after uneventful cataract surgery. On examination, she has a shallow anterior chamber, elevated intraocular pressure (IOP), and a negative seidels test. Another patient presents weeks after cataract surgery with a red, painful eye and increased IOP. Slit-lamp reveals a hypermature cataract and macrophages in the anterior chamber engulfing lens proteins. Which types of glaucoma are these two patients most likely experiencing, respectively?

A 66-year-old hypertensive and diabetic man undergoes retinal imaging. He is found to have flame-shaped hemorrhages, arteriolar narrowing, and cotton wool spots. Which of the following retinal findings would help distinguish hypertensive retinopathy from diabetic retinopathy?

options.label: A
options.text: Hard exudates in a circinate pattern

options.label: D
options.text: Cotton wool spots near the macula

questions.correct_answer: C. Arteriovenous nicking and copper wiring
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Arteriovenous nicking and copper wiring

questions.text: A 29-year-old man with multiple sclerosis reports transient visual obscuration and occasional double vision. Examination reveals anisocoria more marked in bright light. Both pupils constrict on near effort, but one pupil reacts poorly to light. Fundoscopy is unremarkable. What is the most likely underlying finding?

options.label: A
options.text: Damage to the afferent limb of the pupillary reflex

options.label: B
options.text: Aberrant regeneration of third cranial nerve

options.label: C
options.text: Demyelinating lesion near the pretectal nucleus

options.label: D
options.text: Atrophy of iris dilator muscle post trauma

questions.correct_answer: C. Demyelinating lesion near the pretectal nucleus
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Demyelinating lesion near the pretectal nucleus

questions.text: A 28-year-old myopic patient is evaluated for LASIK. His corneal thickness is 500 microns. If each diopter of correction requires 15 microns and the flap created is 110 microns, what is the maximum safe correction that can be performed?

A 65-year-old man presents with sudden-onset horizontal diplopia, especially when looking to the left. He has a history of hypertension and complains of difficulty walking. On examination, he is unable to abduct his left eye and has ataxia on the same side. There is no facial weakness. Which of the following syndromes is most likely involved?
A 12-year-old girl with a history of sinusitis presents with proptosis, ophthalmoplegia, fever, and rapid deterioration of vision. MRI shows an orbital abscess. What is the next best step?

options.label: C
options.text: Immediate IV antibiotics and possible surgical drainage

options.label: D
options.text: CT-guided percutaneous aspiration under local anesthesia

questions.correct_answer: C. Immediate IV antibiotics and possible surgical drainage
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Immediate IV antibiotics and possible surgical drainage

questions.text: Assertion (A): Enucleation is contraindicated in bilateral retinoblastoma cases. Reason (R): Evisceration increases the risk of tumor spread and is always avoided in retinoblastoma.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is false, R is true

options.label: D
options.text: Both A and R are false

questions.correct_answer: C. A is false, R is true
questions.explanation: Ans. C) A is false, R is true

questions.text: Which of the following statements about tear film are TRUE? Aqueous layer is secreted by main and accessory lacrimal glands Lipid layer prevents overflow and retards evaporation Mucous layer is secreted by meibomian glands Mucous layer helps convert hydrophobic corneal surface to hydrophilic
Identify the pathophysiologic process for the ulcer shown in the image below?

options.label: A
options.text: Corneal neovascularization due to VEGF release

options.label: B
options.text: Antigen-antibody immune complex deposition in Descemet’s membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Autoimmune destruction of stromal collagen with inflammatory infiltrates

options.label: D
options.text: Viral cytopathic effect on basal epithelial cells

questions.correct_answer: C. Autoimmune destruction of stromal collagen with inflammatory infiltrates
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Autoimmune destruction of stromal collagen with inflammatory infiltrates

questions.text: A 5-year-old child presents with ptosis, bilateral epicanthus inversus, telecanthus, and poor levator function. Which of the following is the most appropriate management plan?

options.label: C
options.text: Correct epicanthus and telecanthus first, followed by ptosis surgery

questions.correct_answer: C. Correct epicanthus and telecanthus first, followed by ptosis surgery
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Correct epicanthus and telecanthus first, followed by ptosis surgery

questions.text: A patient undergoes a refractive procedure where a small lenticule is removed through a small incision using femtosecond laser, with no flap creation. Which of the following best describes this procedure?

Assertion (A): In pseudomembranous conjunctivitis, the membrane can be peeled without bleeding. Reason (R): The pseudomembrane forms on intact conjunctival epithelium without involving deeper connective tissue.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true but R is false

options.label: D
options.text: A is false but R is true

questions.correct_answer: A. Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

questions.text: A 25-year-old ophthalmology resident is using an indirect ophthalmoscope during a fundus examination. Which of the following features distinguishes indirect ophthalmoscopy from direct ophthalmoscopy?

options.label: B
options.text: Smaller field of view but higher clarity

options.label: C
options.text: Inverted image with better visualization of the periphery

options.label: D
options.text: Real upright image with better macular details

questions.correct_answer: C. Inverted image with better visualization of the periphery
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Inverted image with better visualization of the periphery

questions.text: A 55-year-old diabetic patient presents with progressive vision loss. On fundus evaluation, no media clarity is observed due to dense cataract. Which diagnostic modality will most effectively help visualize the retinal condition in this scenario?

A 40-year-old woman with suspected Best’s disease undergoes Electro-Oculography (EOG) and Electroretinogram (ERG). Her EOG shows subnormal Arden’s ratio, while ERG is normal. What is the most characteristic diagnostic implication of this pattern?

Which of the following statements regarding ocular media and their refractive contributions are true? The refractive index of the lens nucleus is higher than that of the cortex. Vitreous humor has a refractive index nearly identical to aqueous humor. The posterior corneal surface is the most powerful refracting interface in the eye. The anterior lens surface contributes more to total refraction than the posterior lens surface. The total refractive power of the eye is dominated by the lens due to its variable shape.
Assertion (A): Alpha-agonists like brimonidine are avoided in infants with glaucoma. Reason (R): These agents cross the blood-brain barrier and cause CNS depression and bradycardia.

options.label: A
options.text: Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

options.label: B
options.text: Both A and R are true, but R is not the correct explanation of A

options.label: C
options.text: A is true, R is false

options.label: D
options.text: A is false, R is true

questions.correct_answer: A. Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Both A and R are true, and R is the correct explanation of A

questions.text: A 45-year-old woman with longstanding type 1 diabetes undergoes fundus examination showing cotton wool spots, microaneurysms, and hard exudates with thickening within 500 microns of the foveal center. Which of the following treatment strategies is most appropriate to reduce vision-threatening edema in this case?

options.label: A
options.text: Grid laser photocoagulation including foveolar center

questions.text: A 54-year-old man with known carotid artery stenosis presents with a transient episode of monocular vision loss described as a “curtain descending.” He later develops a cherry-red spot and pale retina. Which of the following is the most probable source of the embolus?

A 2-month-old girl presents with bilateral congenital cataracts. Family history reveals multiple relatives with early-onset cataracts. Genetic testing reveals a mutation in the CRY gene, which encodes a structural protein. Which of the following best explains the role of this gene in cataract formation?

options.label: A
options.text: Encodes connexin proteins for nutrient transport

options.label: B
options.text: Produces enzymes involved in glucose metabolism

options.label: C
options.text: Encodes crystallin proteins essential for lens transparency

options.label: D
options.text: Is involved in lens zonule development

questions.correct_answer: C. Encodes crystallin proteins essential for lens transparency
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Encodes crystallin proteins essential for lens transparency

questions.text: A 74-year-old woman presents with painful red eye and markedly reduced vision, as shown in the image below. On examination, Intraocular pressure is found to be elevated. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 70-year-old man presents with acute unilateral vision loss. Fundoscopy reveals tortuous veins, flame-shaped haemorrhages in all quadrants, and macular edema. He has hypertension and hyperlipidaemia. Fluorescein angiography shows delayed venous filling and extensive capillary non-perfusion. Which of the following features best distinguishes this condition from central retinal artery occlusion?
questions.correct_answer: C. Neovascular glaucoma development after 90 days
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Neovascular glaucoma development after 90 days

questions.text: A 55-year-old woman with a history of central retinal artery occlusion presents for follow-up. Fundus examination reveals optic disc pallor, vessel attenuation, and retinal Pallor. What type of optic atrophy is most likely present?

A 29-year-old man with a history of Type 1 diabetes presents with gradual visual blurring. Fundus reveals an immobile concave retinal detachment extending towards the posterior pole, with neovascular membranes visible. What is the pathophysiological basis of this condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Retinal break with vitreous fluid accumulation

options.label: B
options.text: Choroidal fluid leakage under the retina

questions.text: A 29-year-old man presents with bilateral night blindness and progressive constriction of visual fields over several years. Fundoscopy shows bone-spicule pigmentation and attenuated retinal vessels. His younger sister has similar symptoms. OCT shows generalized retinal thinning, and ERG shows markedly reduced amplitude. Which of the following features helps best differentiate this condition from Central Serous Retinopathy?

options.label: A
options.text: Presence of shallow neurosensory detachment on OCT

options.label: B
options.text: Typical onset in middle-aged males under stress

options.label: C
options.text: Tunnel vision and loss of rod function

options.label: D
options.text: Smoke-stack leakage pattern on fluorescein angiography

questions.correct_answer: C. Tunnel vision and loss of rod function
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Tunnel vision and loss of rod function

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy presents during summer with complaints of severe itching, photophobia, and ropy mucoid discharge. On lid eversion, the upper tarsal conjunctiva shows a cobblestone appearance with large flat-topped papillae >1mm. Corneal staining reveals a sterile shield-shaped ulcer. Which of the following best describes the underlying immune mechanism and predominant cell type seen at the limbus?

options.label: A
options.text: Type I hypersensitivity with neutrophilic infiltration

options.label: B
options.text: Type IV hypersensitivity with lymphocytic infiltration

options.label: C
options.text: Type I hypersensitivity with eosinophilic aggregates

options.label: D
options.text: Type III hypersensitivity with immune complex deposition

questions.correct_answer: C. Type I hypersensitivity with eosinophilic aggregates
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Type I hypersensitivity with eosinophilic aggregates

questions.text: A 60-year-old male with a history of hypertension and smoking presents with gradual central visual blurring in both eyes. Fundoscopy shows well-defined drusen deposits in the macular region. OCT reveals retinal pigment epithelial (RPE) thinning. Which of the following features, if present, would most strongly indicate conversion from dry ARMD to wet ARMD?

options.label: A
options.text: RPE hyperplasia with sharply demarcated drusen

options.label: D
options.text: Loss of foveal depression on OCT

questions.correct_answer: C. Presence of choroidal neovascular membranes (CNV)
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Presence of choroidal neovascular membranes (CNV)

questions.text: A 1.5-kg preterm neonate born at 30 weeks' gestation receives supplemental oxygen in NICU. At 4 weeks of age, fundus exam reveals neovascularization and tortuous retinal vessels in zone I, spanning 6 o' clock hours. No retinal detachment is noted. Which of the following is the most appropriate next step?

A 60-year-old man with nuclear cataract is scheduled for cataract removal. He expresses concern about safety and precision and is offered Femtosecond Laser-Assisted Cataract Surgery (FLACS) instead of standard phacoemulsification. Which of the following steps in FLACS is specifically automated by laser and differs from conventional phacoemulsification?

A 60-year-old man with long-standing diabetes presents with progressive blurred central vision. Fundoscopy reveals cystic spaces in the macula with dull foveal reflex. OCT shows fluid-filled spaces in the outer plexiform layer. FFA shows petaloid leakage. Which of the following would most likely be ineffective in this patient's management?

Which of the following statements about acute angle-closure glaucoma are true? The attack typically resolves spontaneously without treatment Conjunctival chemosis and a mid-dilated, fixed pupil are characteristic Visual symptoms include rainbow haloes and rapid loss of vision Treatment involves pilocarpine followed by laser iridotomy

A 30-year-old man presents with bilateral painful red eyes and blurring of vision for the last 5 days. He has a history of trauma to his left eye 1 month ago, which required surgical repair. Slit-lamp examination shows mutton fat keratic precipitates, aqueous flare, and vitritis. Fundoscopy reveals multiple yellow-white lesions at the level of RPE. Which feature would most specifically differentiate this condition from Behçet’s uveitis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Dalen-Fuchs nodules in posterior segment
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Dalen-Fuchs nodules in posterior segment

questions.text: A 22-year-old woman presents with acute onset of vision loss in her right eye. She describes the vision loss as sudden, painful, and associated with difficulty perceiving colors. Fundus examination reveals a normal optic disc. Neurological examination is unremarkable. MRI of the brain is planned to rule out demyelinating pathology. Which of the following types of optic neuritis best corresponds to this patient’s presentation?

Which of the following statements regarding surgical options in pediatric glaucoma is/are true? Goniotomy requires a clear cornea for visualization. Trabeculotomy-trabeculectomy is used in advanced cases with opaque cornea. Drainage implants are used in refractory cases. Mitomycin-C is the preferred adjuvant in first-line trabeculectomy in children.

A 63-year-old man presents for evaluation of chronic open-angle glaucoma. His IOP is consistently elevated despite adherence to topical beta-blockers. Gonioscopy reveals an open angle with visible trabecular meshwork. The ophthalmologist explains that most resistance to aqueous outflow in such cases occurs just before Schlemm’s canal. Which structure contributes most to this resistance?

A 62-year-old woman complains of bumping into objects on one side. Perimetry reveals a paracentral scotoma in the Bjerrum area (10–20° from fixation). Fundus exam shows a cup-to-disc ratio of 0.7 and thinning of the neuroretinal rim. Which type of field defect would most likely progress next?

A 67-year-old man presents with progressive blurring of distance vision over the past year. On examination, there is no axial elongation, but nuclear sclerosis is evident on slit-lamp exam. Which of the following types of myopia does this most likely represent?

A 30-year-old male presents with vertical diplopia that worsens when looking to the right and on tilting his head to the right. On examination, he has a right hypertropia. Park’s Three Step Test is performed. Based on the findings, which muscle is most likely involved?
